channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Marching into the season
item.description: Tiburon Peninsula Little League held its annual parade and block party, while Tiburon Girls Softball celebrated its opening day at Del Mar.
item.dc:creator: The Ark

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A trio of Tiburon teens share love for basketball
item.description: William and Bennett recently celebrated their own championship as members of Del Mar’s eighth-grade boys basketball team.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon yoga teacher retires after 17 years with The Ranch
item.description: Now 71, Diane Green cites a desire to focus on other passions, including art and volunteer work.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Belvedere teens turn passion for cars into detailing business
item.description: As Belvedere Detailing, the Redwood High School juniors say they now wash and detail between five and eight cars a week.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Art & Garden Center can keep amplified music, but it may face future limits
item.description: The Belvedere-Tiburon Landmarks Society must return for an informal check-in in June.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: New sidewalk, safer crossings coming to Strawberry Point Elementary area
item.description: Strawberry Point Elementary School community leaders have sought the improvements for years.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Owners of struggling Cinelounge theater say they hope change to business model can help offset rising costs
item.description: The owners of Tiburon’s downtown movie theater are converting it to a nonprofit.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon’s 16 housing permits in 2024 lag state goals
item.description: On pace for just 20% of the eight-year, 639-unit target, the town would need multiple large developments.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Tiburon, Belvedere poised to join ban of throttle e-bikes for kids
item.description: Marin has banned riders under 16 from using throttle-assisted e-bikes in Strawberry and other unincorporated areas.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Everyday Encounters: A massage therapist enjoys the peaceful surroundings
item.description: Lauren Gravell, the owner of Belvedere Island Spa in downtown Tiburon, says her career in massage therapy came about by chance.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland

item.title: Marin housing advocates highlight crisis and potential solutions at library event
item.description: Representatives outlined Marin’s history of exclusionary zoning, slow development and preservation policies.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Friedland
